text: [Music]
diamonds and toads once upon a time
there lived a fisherman and his wife
they had a little girl called Leena the
fisherman would set out for the river
bank every day and come back with merely
a handful for his family
one fine day as he was setting up his
fishing nets he glanced to the site
where he saw a baby floating down the
river on a giant leaf my goodness what
is this baby doing here floating in this
river I better carry her out else she
may drown the fisherman carried the baby
out gently and took her home to his wife
My dear this child was floating on a
leaf in the water I had to save her and
bring her home we already have a
daughter how do you think we will be
able to raise her the little girl was
named Fiona the farmer loved her as much
as his own daughter over the years Leena
and Fiona grew up into two beautiful
girls while Leena grew up to be like her
mother
Fiona was kind and caring just like her
father the fisherman was very sick and
soon died Fiona was heartbroken
you brought us bad luck you are bad luck
soon the mother's aversion for Fiona
grew more and more she started treating
Fiona like a servant and excluded her
from the family she would make her eat
in the kitchen alone and work
continually apart from the daily chores
Fiona had to go twice a day to draw
water more than a mile and a half from
the house and bring home a pitcher full
of it one day she went to the fountain
and sat there crying bitterly just then
a poor woman came up to her and said of
course Fiona wiped her tears poured
water for the poor woman holding up the
picture all the while that she might
drink it easily the woman having drunk
the water said I cannot help giving you
a gift every time something touches your
heart and comes out in the form of Tears
they shall turn into diamonds and pearls
the poor woman was actually a fairy and
as soon as she joined her hands she
turned into a fairy fiona was speechless
as Fiona dropped on her feet in
disbelief the fairy smiled and vanished
Fiona reached home only to find her
mother fuming in anger how dare you take
so long to get back from the fountain
don't you know that Lena and I are
thirsty at once you go to the kitchen
sorry mother
as soon as Fiona entered the kitchen she
left a pitcher down and began weeping
bitterly and just as the fairy had
promised her tears turned into sparkling
diamonds and shiny pearls as they rolled
down her cheeks the mother entered the
kitchen and saw Theo no weeping diamonds
and pearls I see their perils and
diamonds rolling down your cheeks how is
this happening
Fiona explained what had happened while
she was at the fountain and her mother
was quite astonished Leena you shall go
to the fountain immediately would you
not be glad my dear to have the same
gift you only have to go and throw a
water out of the fountain and when a
poor woman asks you to let her drink
give it to her very civilly and
you two shall have as many diamonds and
perils as you like as you say mother
very well off you go then
lino went to the fountain taking with
the best silver tankard in the house as
she drew water from the fountain she saw
a magnificently dressed lady coming out
of the forest who came up to her and
asked for a drink of water have I come
here to serve you with water
I suppose this silver tankard was
brought Pearlie for your ladyship was it
you are scarcely polite well then since
you are so unfriendly and me I curse you
that every time you wish to speak you
shall only croak like a frog Lina you
reached out to stop her quote realizing
it was too late Lina started weeping and
as she sounds came out of her my
daughter what is that sound you're
making
Lina tried to speak but she has been
cursed my daughter's been cursed oh
mercy
it is you who has caused all this and
you shall pay for it when the time comes
go out and get some woods my lina is
starving
fiona was deeply hurt and ran outside
the house leaving pearls and diamonds
dropping on her way the next morning
when fiona was out by the barn all alone
she started to sing today shall be a
beautiful day beautiful day I wish take
my sorrows take my pain and fulfill all
my wish just then a prince was passing
by and he sees her from a distance
barely being able to get a clear look at
her the Prince smiles he is mesmerized
by her beautiful voice Fiona went back
into the house not aware that the prince
had seen her the prince could not stay
without seeing her face he ordered his
guards to wait and went to the Fiona's
house to see her
hello sire what is it that brings you
here I saw a girl out by the barn
with a voice so beautiful and angelic
that I have fallen in love with her who
is she
well she is my daughter I shall go get
her right away
Leena quickly wear your sisters clothes
and go outside for a princess come to
see you Oh such a lovely voice you have
it has set my heart alight and I would
love to take you as my bride it would
bring me great joy if you could sing for
me once more so that I may hold an
essence of your beautiful voice in this
shell for my mother to hear so that she
may approve of this marriage Leena in
all her excitement tries to sing and
ends up croaking what kind of mockery is
this are you insulting me guards seize
this woman and take her away immediately
oh please forgive my sister for she's
cursed that whenever she wishes to speak
she will croak like a frog I was the one
singing out by the barn the prince was
mesmerised to see Fiona but wanted to
make sure that he was not being fooled
will you please sing for me Oh forgive
my sister but she is cursed it was I who
was singing the song she is troubled
enough don't make it worse I beg you
almighty Prince be strong the prince was
quite impressed with her voice your
voice is as beautiful as you are and it
reflects you must have a beautiful heart
too I would love to make you my princess
forgive me Prince I must decline as it
is my sister's dream to get married to a
prince what I cannot marry a lying toad
fiona kneels down looking up at the sky
o magical fairy please come to help me
and give my blessings to my sister I am
ready to take upon myself her curse so
that she may fulfill her dream and marry
a prince seeing her sister pray for her
Lena runs and hugs her little sister as
she cries and sobs just then the fairy
appears in front of them
I see that you have learned your lesson
I shall take away your curse and now
when you wish to speak the most
beautiful voice shall come free
the fairy waved her one and Lena was
engulfed in magic just as her sister was
thank you so much I am so grateful for
this gift
the fairy smiled waved her magic wand
and vanished I would love to marry you
Fiona for I have fallen in love with
your kind and forgiving heart and as for
your sister my younger brother would
only be too glad to marry her and he
shall keep her very happy
Fiona was overjoyed at the princes
proposal and they decided to get married
at once a grand wedding was held and
both the sisters got married people from
all over the kingdom were invited
however their mother was not a year had
passed and the kingdom rejoiced at the
birth of a beautiful little baby
Princess Fiona held the baby princess in
her arms as the little princess cried
for the first time a little tear rolled
down her cheek and transformed into a
sparkling diamond kindness one once
again
[Music]
